intro: Senecio tercentenariae, commonly known as the Three-Hundred-Year Senecio, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small yellow flowers in clusters, which are typical of the daisy family. It is adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its unique appearance and slow growth, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
